ShortDescription: CASH FOR WORK-INITIATIVE IN NORTHERN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: Cash for Work-Initiative in northern Iraq
LongDescription: Temporary stabilisation of vulnerable households of refugees, IDPs and host community members in Northern Iraq. Internally displaced persons, refugees and host community members take advantage of a range of temporary income and employment opportunities in the Kurdish provinces of Dohuk, Erbil and Sulaymaniyah.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ShortDescription: HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE - PROTECTION AND ASSISTANCE
ProjectTitle: Humanitarian Assistance - Protection and assistance
LongDescription: The Germany-funded humanitarian assistance project in Iraq during 2015, implemented by the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR), aimed to provide protection and assistance to internally displaced persons (IDPs) affected by ongoing conflict. With a budget of €12 million, the project focused on enhancing the safety and well-being of IDPs through various interventions, including legal aid, psychosocial support, and the establishment of safe spaces. The initiative was part of Germany's broader commitment to addressing the humanitarian crisis in Iraq, as reflected in its financial contributions to the Iraq Humanitarian Response Plan for that year.

ShortDescription: IMPROVEMENT OF LIVING CONDITIONS OF IDPS AND HOST COMMUNITIES IN DOHUK, NORTHERN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: Improvement of living conditions of IDPs and host communities in Dohuk, northern Iraq
LongDescription: The Germany-funded project aimed at improving the living conditions of internally displaced persons (IDPs) and host communities in the Dohuk and Erbil governorates of the Kurdistan Region of Iraq. Implemented in 2016, the initiative focused on stabilizing households affected by displacement, refugees, and host populations. Key interventions included enhancing the capacities of local governmental structures responsible for education, vocational training, and social affairs, enabling them to better deliver services to these communities. The project contributed to the stabilization of a region heavily impacted by the consequences of conflict.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ShortDescription: EU ADVISORY MISSION IN SUPPORT OF SECURITY SECTOR REFORM IN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: EU Advisory Mission in support of Security Sector Reform in Iraq
LongDescription: EU Advisory Mission in support of Security Sector Reform in Iraq

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: STABILISATION FACILITY (UNITED NATIONS DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMME)
ProjectTitle: Stabilisation facility (United Nations Development Programme)
LongDescription: Germany's 2017 contribution to the United Nations Development Programme's (UNDP) Funding Facility for Stabilization (FFS) focused on strengthening Iraq's legal capacity and efficiency in stabilization and reconstruction efforts. The initiative aimed to support the Iraqi government in its crisis response and recovery by enhancing institutional capacities and facilitating the rehabilitation of critical infrastructure in areas affected by conflict. This contribution was part of Germany's broader commitment to Iraq's stabilization, building upon previous support to the FFS
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: STABILISATION AND EMPLOYMENT, FFIS/ICRRP
ProjectTitle: Stabilisation and employment, FFIS/ICRRP
LongDescription: Germany's 2017 initiative aimed to provide short-term employment and income opportunities for approximately 14,500 individuals in Iraq, focusing on internally displaced persons (IDPs), returnees, and host communities. Implemented through the Funding Facility for Immediate Stabilization (FFIS) and the Iraq Crisis Response and Resilience Programme (ICRRP), the project engaged participants in cash-for-work activities such as debris removal, infrastructure rehabilitation, and community services. These efforts not only offered immediate financial relief but also contributed to the stabilization and rebuilding of areas affected by conflict.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ShortDescription: HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE - HUMANITARIAN POOLED FUND
ProjectTitle: Humanitarian Assistance - Humanitarian Pooled Fund
LongDescription: Germany's financial contribution to the Humanitarian Pooled Fund (HPF) in Iraq in 2017 amounted to approximately $5.9 million. This funding was directed towards enhancing the coordination and delivery of humanitarian assistance to populations affected by conflict and displacement. The HPF facilitated rapid and flexible funding allocations to partners on the ground, ensuring timely responses to urgent needs in various regions of Iraq.

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: UNDP IRAK, STABILIZATION AND EMPLOYMENT
ProjectTitle: UNDP Irak, Stabilization and Employment
LongDescription: The 2018 Germany-funded project under the UNDP’s Funding Facility for Stabilization (FFS) focused on enhancing stabilization and employment opportunities in areas of Iraq liberated from ISIL. The initiative aimed to provide short-term employment and income opportunities for approximately 14,500 individuals, including internally displaced persons (IDPs), returnees, and host communities. Implemented through cash-for-work programs, the project engaged participants in activities such as debris removal, infrastructure rehabilitation, and community services. These efforts not only offered immediate financial relief but also contributed to the stabilization and rebuilding of areas affected by conflict.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: RESILIENCE BUILDING THROUGH EMPLOYMENT GENERATION IN CRISIS AFFECTED COMMUNITIES OF IRAQ
ProjectTitle: Resilience building through employment generation in crisis affected communities of Iraq
LongDescription: The 2019 project aimed to provide short-term and medium-term employment opportunities to approximately 16,000 Iraqis, including internally displaced persons (IDPs), returnees, and host community members. Funded by Germany through KfW Development Bank and implemented by UNDP, the initiative focused on enhancing economic resilience by offering cash-for-work programs, vocational training, and support for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). These interventions targeted areas heavily impacted by conflict, aiming to restore livelihoods and promote social cohesion.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ShortDescription: THIRD TRANCHE CONTRIBUTION TOWARDS UNITED NATIONS HIGH COMMISSIONER FOR REFUGEES (UNHCR) S IRAQIS (GNA) ANNUAL BUDGET ACTIVITIES
ProjectTitle: Third Tranche Contribution Towards United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) s Iraqis (Gna) Annual Budget Activities
LongDescription: United States Population Migration and Refugee Assistance, Appropriation 1143. Protection and assistance needs of refugees, migrants and conflict vicitms worldwide. [United Nations Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees]

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: UNDP IRAQ - STABILIZATION, RECONSTRUCTION AND EMPLOYMENT
ProjectTitle: UNDP Iraq - Stabilization, Reconstruction and Employment
LongDescription: This initiative aims to contribute to local stabilization and improve the living conditions of targeted populations in Iraq. Phase 1 of the project consists of two main components: (1) immediate stabilization through the Funding Facility for Immediate Stabilization (FFIS), and (2) strengthening resilience under the Iraq Crisis Response and Resilience Programme (ICRRP). The focus is on areas in central Iraq and northern Iraq that were heavily damaged by Islamist groups and have since been liberated, where many refugees and internally displaced persons have temporarily sought refuge. The project includes activities such as infrastructure rehabilitation, livelihood support, and social cohesion efforts to help rebuild and stabilize communities.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ShortDescription: HUMANITARIAN IMPLEMENTATION PLAN 2019 IRAQ
ProjectTitle: HUMANITARIAN IMPLEMENTATION PLAN 2019 IRAQ
LongDescription: HUMANITARIAN IMPLEMENTATION PLAN 2019 IRAQ

ProjectTitle: Iraq Task Order - SWIFT IV
PurposeName: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
LongDescription: Iraq Task Order under the Support Which Implements Fast Transitions IV (SWIFT IV) IDQ
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: IRAQ GOVERNANCE PERFORMANCE AND ACCOUNTABILITY PROJECT - IGPA
ProjectTitle: Iraq Governance Performance and Accountability Project - IGPA
LongDescription: IGPA will support the Iraqi Government to shore up fiscal stability while rapidly and visibly improving service delivery. The project aims to build capacity for Iraqi government service delivery, improve governorate and national government public financial management, and strengthen monitoring and oversight of service delivery and public expenditure.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE - FOOD SUPPLIES FOR INTERNALLY DISPLACED PERSONS (IDPS)
ProjectTitle: Humanitarian Assistance - Food supplies for internally displaced persons (IDPs)
LongDescription: In 2016, Germany, through the Federal Foreign Office (AA), committed €2.49 million to support the World Food Programme (WFP) in delivering emergency food assistance to IDPs in Iraq. The project aimed to stabilize destitute households of IDPs, refugees, and host communities in northern Iraq, particularly in the governorates of Dohuk, Erbil, and Sulaymaniyah. The assistance included the provision of food supplies to meet the immediate nutritional needs of affected populations.

ShortDescription: AWARD TO THE WFP IS FOR EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE TO POPULATIONS AFFECTED BY THE IRAQ CRISIS
ProjectTitle: Award to the WFP is for emergency assistance to populations affected by the Iraq crisis
LongDescription: The World Food Programme (WFP), with funding from the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), has been providing emergency food assistance to populations affected by the Iraq crisis. One significant implementation site for these efforts is the Domiz Refugee Camp, located in the Dohuk Governorate of the Kurdistan Region of Iraq. Established in April 2012, Domiz Camp has been a primary location for Syrian refugees and has received substantial support from WFP for food distribution and other humanitarian assistance.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: GRANT AWARD TO THE WORLD FOOD PROGRAM IN SUPPORT OF THE NEW TRANSITIONAL INTERIM COUNTRY STRATEGIC PLAN (TICSP) FOR IRAQ
ProjectTitle: Grant Award to the World Food Program in support of the new Transitional Interim Country Strategic Plan (TICSP) for Iraq
LongDescription: The World Food Programme (WFP), with funding from the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), implemented the Transitional Interim Country Strategic Plan (TICSP) in Iraq from January 2018 to June 2019. This plan aimed to transition from emergency assistance to resilience-building and development-focused interventions. Key activities included providing food assistance to internally displaced persons (IDPs) and Syrian refugees, implementing emergency school meals programs, and supporting vocational training initiatives such as the "Tech for Food" program. These efforts were concentrated in various regions, including Mosul, where the school meals program reached 87,000 children, and Sulaymaniyah, where the "Tech for Food" program was piloted. One significant implementation site was Mosul, where WFP's emergency school meals program was launched.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: HUMANITARIAN IMPLEMENTATION PLAN IRAQ 2020
ProjectTitle: Humanitarian Implementation Plan Iraq 2020
LongDescription: Humanitarian Implementation Plan Iraq 2020

ShortDescription: HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE - HEALTH SERVICES FOR CONFLICT AFFECTED POPULATIONS IN IRAQ.
ProjectTitle: Humanitarian Assistance - Health services for conflict affected populations in Iraq.
LongDescription: The USAID-funded Humanitarian Assistance – Health Services for Conflict-Affected Populations in Iraq project, implemented in partnership with the World Health Organization (WHO) and the European Union Humanitarian Aid (ECHO), aimed to strengthen essential primary, referral, and preventive healthcare services in conflict-affected governorates of Iraq. The project targeted an estimated 800,000 vulnerable individuals, including internally displaced persons (IDPs) in camps and informal settlements, as well as host communities. Key interventions included supporting 22 primary healthcare centers across six governorates—Anbar, Duhok, Erbil, Kirkuk, Ninewa, and Sulaymaniyah—providing over 1.6 million consultations through these centers and approximately half a million consultations via mobile medical clinics. The project also focused on mental health and psychosocial support services, particularly for women, and enhanced Iraq's capacity to detect and respond to communicable disease outbreaks through the Early Warning, Alert, and Response Network (EWARN)
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: STRENGTHENING RESILIENCE IN MANAGING CRISES AND CONFLICTS IN THE PROVINCE OF NINEWA
ProjectTitle: Strengthening resilience in managing crises and conflicts in the province of Ninewa
PurposeName: Multisector aid for basic social services
LongDescription: The main goal of the project is to strengthen the resilience of the population in the Iraqi province of Ninewa.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: CRISIS-PREVENTIVE RECONSTRUCTION MOSSUL
ProjectTitle: Crisis-preventive reconstruction Mossul
LongDescription: The 2017 project "Crisis-preventive Reconstruction Mosul" aimed to strengthen the resilience of vulnerable populations in selected areas of Nineveh Governorate, focusing on rebuilding infrastructure, restoring essential services, and supporting social cohesion to reduce the risk of renewed conflict. This initiative targeted communities heavily affected by violence and displacement to foster stability and improve living conditions.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ShortDescription: THE PROJECT OF ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY BUILDING FOR CRITICAL CARE SERVICES IN THE MEDICAL CITY
ProjectTitle: The Project of Organizational Capacity Building for Critical Care Services in the Medical City
LongDescription: The "Project of Organizational Capacity Building for Critical Care Services in the Medical City" commenced in 2016 with funding from the Korea International Cooperation Agency (KOICA). This initiative aimed to establish the Iraq-Korea Critical Care Specialty Hospital (IKCCSH) within Baghdad's Medical City. The project encompassed the construction of a four-story hospital building covering approximately 6,905 square meters, featuring 70 ICU beds, 8 operating rooms, and specialized facilities for cardiac and cerebral catheterization. Additionally, over 2,250 medical devices were provided, including equipment for endoscopic gastrointestinal surgeries and 17 dialysis machines. The project also included the provision and installation of medical equipment, technical assistance such as master planning and capacity building, and pilot management of the hospital

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: WINTERCAMP FOR REFUGEES IN NORTHERN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: Wintercamp for Refugees in northern Iraq
LongDescription: The plan pursues the aim to improve the living conditions of the inside expelled (IDP) and the local population in the admission area Dohuk in Northern Iraq. Spheres of activity are the construction of firm lodgings in a settlement newly to be established, the winter-firm building of lodgings in shells and support measures in the areas child protection, education, health.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ShortDescription: 2019 GLOBAL APPEAL/SYRIA 3RP
ProjectTitle: 2019 Global Appeal/Syria 3RP
LongDescription: The 2019 Global Appeal/Syria 3RP, funded by the U.S. Population, Migration, and Refugee Assistance appropriation, supported Syrian refugees in Iraq through the UNHCR-led Regional Refugee and Resilience Plan (3RP). A key implementation site was the Bardarash Refugee Camp in the Dohuk Governorate, which reopened in October 2019 to accommodate over 11,000 Syrian refugees fleeing conflict.

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: ECONOMIC RECONSTRUCTION IOM
ProjectTitle: Economic reconstruction IOM
LongDescription: In total, 8,100 people in need (5,670 men and 2,430 women) will be directly reached through the proposed measures and 21 smaller economic infrastructure measures will be implemented in Phase IV of this project.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: EDUCATION, CHILD PROTECTION, WASH, PSYCHOSOCIAL SUPPORT
ProjectTitle: Education, child protection, WASH, psychosocial support
LongDescription: The objective of the project is to improve access and quality, public education, psychosocial and psychological support, public water supply and sanitation facilities.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: FUNDING FACILITY FOR EXPANDED STABILIZATION
ProjectTitle: Funding Facility for Expanded Stabilization
LongDescription: The 2018 Germany-funded project under the UNDP’s Funding Facility for Expanded Stabilization (FFES) aimed to support the Iraqi government's capacity for stabilization and reconstruction in areas liberated from ISIL. The initiative focused on rehabilitating critical infrastructure, restoring essential services, and strengthening local governance to facilitate the safe return of internally displaced persons (IDPs) and promote long-term stability. By enhancing the Iraqi government's ability to act effectively, the project sought to lay the groundwork for sustainable development and peace in post-conflict regions.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: IMPROVEMENT OF THE GENERAL CONDITIONS FOR THE PERMANENT RETURN OF DISPLACED PEOPLE TO THE NINEWA PLAINS - PHASE 1
ProjectTitle: Improvement of the general conditions for the permanent return of displaced people to the Ninewa plains - Phase 1
LongDescription: An increased return and reintegration of the fugitive population of the Ninewa plain into their former residential areas. War-damaged houses of displaced persons are repaired in such a way that a dignified return is made possible. Community spaces/areas accessible to various ethnic-religious groups, e.g. parks, playgrounds, sports fields, kindergartens, schools and multipurpose halls, are being rehabilitated. Smaller water and electricity infrastructures will be repaired, especially on the rehabilitated communal areas. Activities to promote peace and social cohesion.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ShortDescription: MACRO GRANT FY2018
ProjectTitle: Macro Grant FY2018
LongDescription: The Macro Grant FY2018, funded by the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID) through the Bureau for Humanitarian Assistance (BHA), provided humanitarian support to the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) for activities in Iraq. While specific project locations are not publicly disclosed, such grants typically support agricultural recovery and resilience in areas affected by conflict. Given the nature of FAO's work in Iraq, a significant implementation site is likely the Ninewa Governorate, particularly around Mosul, where agricultural rehabilitation efforts have been concentrated.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: CONTRIBUTION TO UNITED NATIONS HIGH COMMISSIONER FOR REFUGEES (UNHCR) NEEDS DEFINED IN THE SYRIA REGIONAL RESPONSE PLAN 5 - IRAQ
ProjectTitle: Contribution To United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) Needs Defined in The Syria Regional Response Plan 5 - Iraq
LongDescription: The Domiz Refugee Camp in the Dohuk Governorate of the Kurdistan Region of Iraq was a primary implementation site for the Syria Regional Response Plan 5 (RRP5), funded by the United States through the Population, Migration, and Refugee Assistance appropriation. Established in April 2012, Domiz Camp has been a central location for Syrian refugees, particularly those of Kurdish origin, fleeing the Syrian civil war. The camp has received substantial support from UNHCR and various international partners to provide shelter, protection, and essential services to its residents.

ShortDescription: 2019 SPECIAL MEASURE IN FAVOUR OF IRAQ - PART 2
ProjectTitle: 2019 Special Measure in favour of Iraq - part 2
LongDescription: Support to Governance and Job creation in agriculture and agribusiness in Iraq

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: UNDP IRAQ - BUILDING RESILIENCE BY CREATING JOBS IN AFFECTED CRISIS AREAS IN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: UNDP Iraq - Building resilience by creating jobs in affected crisis areas in Iraq
LongDescription: The aim of the SI measure is to improve income security and the socio-economic inclusion of internally displaced persons, returnees and the receiving population in the target areas by creating short, medium and long-term income and employment opportunities.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ShortDescription: EUROPEAN UNION ADVISORY MISSION IN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: EUROPEAN UNION ADVISORY MISSION IN IRAQ
PurposeName: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
LongDescription: EUAM Iraq contributes to a safer and stronger Iraq, through its support, engagement and participation in an effective and sustainable Security Sector Reform Process (SSRP)

ShortDescription: BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF THE GOVERNMENT
ProjectTitle: Building the capacity of the Government
PurposeName: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
LongDescription: The 2017 Germany-funded initiative under the UNDP’s Funding Facility for Immediate Stabilization (FFIS), specifically Window Three—Capacity Support, aimed to bolster the Iraqi government's ability to stabilize and govern areas liberated from ISIL. This component focused on providing technical assistance to local authorities, enhancing their planning, implementation, and monitoring capacities. By deploying technical experts and supporting institutional development, the project sought to ensure that local governments could effectively respond to stabilization needs and rebuild trust with affected communities

ShortDescription: HUMANITARIAN IMPLEMENTATION PLAN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: HUMANITARIAN IMPLEMENTATION PLAN IRAQ
LongDescription: HUMANITARIAN IMPLEMENTATION PLAN IRAQ 2021, Funding Countries: IRAQ

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: FUNDING FACILITY FOR EXPANDED STABILISATION (FFES), PHASE 3
ProjectTitle: Funding Facility for Expanded Stabilisation (FFES), Phase 3
LongDescription: Contribute to strengthening the Iraqi government's ability to act and perform in the area of stabilisation and reconstruction. In order to achieve this, the public infrastructure in Iraq should be repaired or rebuilt to such an extent that the basic needs of the local population can be guaranteed and the permanent return of internally displaced persons to their homes can be made possible.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ShortDescription: DEMOCRACY, HUMAN RIGHTS AND LABOR PROGRAM - UNSPECIFIED PROJECT
ProjectTitle: Democracy, Human Rights and Labor Program - Unspecified Project
LongDescription: The Democracy, Human Rights, and Labor Program in Iraq, funded by the U.S. Department of State's Bureau of Democracy, Human Rights, and Labor (DRL), supports initiatives aimed at promoting democratic principles, human rights, and the rule of law. While specific project details are not publicly disclosed due to the sensitive nature of such programs, DRL has issued calls for proposals targeting various regions in Iraq, including Baghdad, Erbil, and Basrah. These programs often focus on empowering civil society organizations, enhancing political participation, and protecting the rights of vulnerable groups.

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: EDUCATION PROGRAMME (UNICEF)
ProjectTitle: Education Programme (UNICEF)
LongDescription: The 2016 Germany-funded UNICEF education program in Iraq aimed to enhance access to both formal and informal education, as well as psychosocial support, for refugee children, internally displaced persons (IDPs), and host community children. Implemented nationwide, the initiative targeted approximately 385,000 children, focusing on providing temporary learning spaces, educational supplies, and teacher training to improve the quality of education in crisis-affected areas. The program also emphasized the importance of psychosocial support to help children cope with the trauma of displacement and conflict.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: WATER SUPPLY / DISPOSAL SEWAGE FOR SYRIAN REFUGEES
ProjectTitle: Water supply / disposal sewage for Syrian refugees
LongDescription: The planned interventions subdivide to themselves into three spheres of activity (1) conversion of priority measures in the water supply and sanitary care, (2) installations of a new drinking water care system of the district Faida, and (3) strengthening of the capacities of partner organisations.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: CONSTRUCTION OF REHABITITATIONS AND CENTRES OF TREATMENT FOR VICTIM OF HUMAN RIGHTS ABUSES AS WELL AS REMOVAL AND CONSTRUCTION OF HEALTH CENTRES
ProjectTitle: Construction of Rehabititations and centres of treatment for victim of human rights abuses as well as removal and construction of health centres
LongDescription: The aim of the plan is to improve the medical and psychosocial care of internally displaced persons, refugees and the population in admission municipalities. The plan focuses on the province of Dohuk in the autonomous region Kurdistan in the north of Iraq and acts in three spheres of activity.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: UNDP IRAQ - STABILISATION AND EMPLOYMENT, FFIS/ICRRP
ProjectTitle: UNDP Iraq - Stabilisation and employment, FFIS/ICRRP
LongDescription: The 2017 Germany-funded project under the UNDP’s Funding Facility for Immediate Stabilization (FFIS) and the Iraq Crisis Response and Resilience Programme (ICRRP) aimed to improve the economic and social living conditions of internally displaced persons (IDPs) and host communities in Iraq. The initiative focused on providing short-term employment opportunities, vocational training, and support for small businesses, thereby enhancing income security and promoting social cohesion in areas affected by conflict and displacement.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ShortDescription: DEMOCRACY, HUMAN RIGHTS AND LABOR PROGRAM - UNSPECIFIED ACTIVITY
ProjectTitle: Democracy, Human Rights and Labor Program - Unspecified Activity
LongDescription: In 2020, the Democracy, Human Rights, and Labor Program, funded by the U.S. Department of State (DRL), continued its support for strengthening civil society, political participation, and human rights protections in Iraq. As part of this effort, the program hosted a series of workshops and conferences aimed at empowering activists, NGOs, and local governance actors. A notable event took place at the Royal Tulip Al Rasheed Hotel in Baghdad’s Green Zone, bringing together stakeholders from across Iraq to discuss transparency, freedom of expression, and inclusive governance.

ShortDescription: HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE - EMERGENCY FOOD ASSISTANCE
ProjectTitle: Humanitarian Assistance - Emergency food assistance
LongDescription: In 2017, Germany contributed €6 million to the United Nations World Food Programme (WFP) to provide emergency food assistance to internally displaced persons (IDPs) and Syrian refugees in Iraq. This funding supported WFP's monthly food distributions, which were essential for over 1.4 million displaced individuals facing food insecurity due to ongoing conflicts and economic challenges. The assistance aimed to alleviate immediate hunger and improve the nutritional status of vulnerable populations, particularly in regions such as Duhok and Sulaymaniyah in the Kurdistan Region of Iraq. This contribution was part of Germany's broader commitment to humanitarian aid in Iraq, addressing the urgent needs of those affected by displacement and conflict

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: IMPROVING LIVELIHOODS AND GENERAL LIVING CONDITIONS FOR RETURNING REFUGEES AND THE LOCAL POPULATION IN NINEVEH PROVINCE, NORTHERN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: Improving livelihoods and general living conditions for returning refugees and the local population in Nineveh Province, Northern Iraq
LongDescription: The 2020 Germany-funded project supported the Iraq Reform, Recovery and Reconstruction Fund (I3RF), a World Bank-managed initiative launched in November 2018. The I3RF serves as a platform for coordinated development and dialogue on reform, restoration, reconstruction, and development in Iraq. It focuses on providing technical assistance, pilot programs, and advisory support to the Government of Iraq (GoI) in areas such as socio-economic recovery, reconstruction, national economic and financial governance reforms, and private-sector-led economic growth. The fund collaborates with over 28 line ministries and other government entities to develop concrete action plans for implementing economic reforms through technical assistance, advisory services, analytical work, and recipient-executed pilot projects. In 2022, the I3RF produced 39 multi-sectoral analytical works to support economic reforms and diversification in Iraq. I3RF projects have informed policy and programming in reconstruction, agriculture, environment, energy, social protection, education, public financial management, the financial sector, the private sector, poverty programming, and peacebuilding.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ShortDescription: SUPPORT FOR HEALTH PROGRAMS IN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: Support for health programs in Iraq
LongDescription: From 2018 to 2019, the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), through its Office of U.S. Foreign Disaster Assistance (OFDA), supported health programs across Iraq, focusing on conflict-affected populations. These initiatives aimed to restore essential health services, including primary care, maternal and child health, and mental health support, particularly in areas impacted by displacement and conflict. One significant implementation site was the Al Qayyarah General Hospital in Ninewa Governorate, which served as a critical referral center during the Mosul crisis.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: INITIAL CONTRIBUTION FOR INTERNATIONAL ORGANIZATION FOR MIGRATION COMMUNITY REVITALIZATION PROGRAM - PHASE IX, TO CONTINUE CONTRIBUTING TO STABILIZATI
ProjectTitle: Initial Contribution for International Organization for Migration Community Revitalization Program - Phase Ix, to Continue Contributing to Stabilization Efforts By the Government of Iraq
LongDescription: The Community Revitalization Program (CRP) – Phase IX, funded by the U.S. Department of State's Bureau of Population, Refugees, and Migration (PRM), was implemented by the International Organization for Migration (IOM) to support stabilization efforts in Iraq. This phase focused on improving conditions for the sustainable socio-economic inclusion of vulnerable individuals, including internally displaced persons (IDPs) and returnees, in communities affected by conflict. Key activities included livelihood assistance, rehabilitation of infrastructure, and social cohesion initiatives.

ShortDescription: INITIAL CONTRIBUTION FOR INTERNATIONAL ORGANIZATION FOR MIGRATION COMMUNITY REVITALIZATION PROGRAM - PHASE IX, TO CONTINUE CONTRIBUTING TO STABILIZATI
ProjectTitle: Initial Contribution for International Organization for Migration Community Revitalization Program - Phase Ix, to Continue Contributing to Stabilization Effors By the Government of Iraq
LongDescription: In 2020, the International Organization for Migration (IOM), with funding from the U.S. Department of State's Bureau of Population, Refugees, and Migration (PRM), launched Phase IX of its Community Revitalization Program (CRP) in Iraq. This phase aimed to support stabilization efforts by the Government of Iraq through initiatives that included livelihood assistance, infrastructure rehabilitation, and social cohesion activities.

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: EDUCATION, CHILD PROTECTION AND WASH, PHASE 5
ProjectTitle: Education, child protection and WASH, Phase 5
LongDescription: In 2020, Germany funded UNICEF's Phase 5 initiative in Iraq to continue providing transitional aid, focusing on education, child protection, and water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) services. This phase aimed to ensure equitable access to basic services for vulnerable populations, including internally displaced persons (IDPs), returnees, and host communities. The project sought to strengthen resilience and support the recovery of affected communities by improving educational opportunities, enhancing child protection mechanisms, and ensuring access to safe water and sanitation facilities. Germany's contribution was part of a broader effort to support UNICEF's programs in Iraq, addressing the needs of over one million people across various sectors.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ProjectTitle: Promoting socio-economic development in Iraq: job creation and income generation
LongDescription: Special Measure 2019 Part 1 - To promote the stability and socio-economic development of Iraq through the creation of job opportunities and the development of skills among the most vulnerable groups in the society, in particular youth, women and returnee population.

ShortDescription: MINE AND IED (IMPROVISED EXPLOSIVE DEVICE) CLEARANCE
ProjectTitle: Mine and IED (improvised explosive device) clearance
PurposeName: Removal of land mines and explosive remnants of war
LongDescription: In 2017, Germany contributed €2.2 million to the United Nations Mine Action Service (UNMAS) to support the clearance of explosive hazards in newly retaken areas of Iraq. This funding enabled UNMAS to provide technical advice, training, and direct clearance operations, focusing on residential areas to facilitate the safe return of internally displaced persons (IDPs) and promote stabilization efforts. The project was part of Germany's broader commitment to supporting Iraq's recovery and reconstruction following the conflict with ISIS

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: WINTERCAMP FOR REFUGEES IN NORTHERN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: Wintercamp for refugees in northern Iraq
LongDescription: The plan pursues the aim to improve the living conditions of the inside expelled (IDP) and the local population in the admission area Dohuk in Northern Iraq. Spheres of activity are the construction of firm lodgings in a settlement newly to be established, the winter-firm building of lodgings in shells and support measures in the areas child protection, education, health.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: CONTRIBUTE TO THE ECONOMIC RECOVERY OF IRAQ THROUGH EMPLOYMENT CREATION AND REVITALIZATION OF LOCAL ECONOMY/ IOM PHASE V
ProjectTitle: Contribute to the economic recovery of Iraq through employment creation and revitalization of local economy/ IOM Phase V
LongDescription: Generating income and employment opportunities for IDPs, returnees and local people in need in host communities. KfW finances short-term (cash for work, vocational training and internships) and longer-term (grants for SMEs) supporting measures as well as the reconstruction of economically relevant infrastructure via IOM.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: COVID19 ??URGENT HEALTH SUPPORT PROGRAM IRAQ - PHASE I
ProjectTitle: Covid19 Urgent Health Support Program Iraq - Phase I
LongDescription: The main goal of the project is to support the Iraqi health system in the care of Covid19 patients and to create additional basic infrastructure for this purpose. To achieve this, up to five temporary prefabricated hospitals with 100 beds each, including 40 intensive care beds, are to be built and equipped. The locations identified are Baghdad, Mosul, Basra and Sulaimaniya as well as Anbar (BMZ preference) or Najaf. Each hospital is expected to be able to treat 1,800 patients (total number of patients 9,000).
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: EDUCATION OF CHILDREN AND CHILD PROTECTION IN IRAQ VIA UNICEF
ProjectTitle: Education of children and child protection in Iraq via UNICEF
LongDescription: In 2015, UNICEF, with support from Germany, focused on enhancing educational opportunities and child protection for Syrian and Iraqi children affected by conflict in Iraq. The initiative aimed to improve learning conditions and provide psychosocial support through various interventions, including the establishment of Child Friendly Spaces (CFS) and non-formal education programs. These efforts were particularly concentrated in areas with high numbers of displaced children, such as the Kurdistan Region of Iraq. The project sought to create safe and supportive environments that facilitated learning and addressed the psychological needs of children, thereby contributing to their overall well-being and resilience.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ShortDescription: INTERNATIONAL NARCOTICS & LAW ENFORCEMENT: OVERSEAS CONTINGENCY OPERATIONS
ProjectTitle: International Narcotics & Law Enforcement: Overseas Contingency Operations
LongDescription: The International Narcotics & Law Enforcement (INL): Overseas Contingency Operations program, administered by the U.S. Department of State, has been instrumental in strengthening Iraq's criminal justice system and enhancing law enforcement capabilities. In 2020, the INL continued its efforts by providing training, mentoring, and support to Iraqi law enforcement and judicial institutions, aiming to promote the rule of law and combat organized crime.

ShortDescription: FY 2017 SYRIA HUMANITARIAN RESPONSE
ProjectTitle: FY 2017 Syria Humanitarian Response
LongDescription: The FY 2017 Syria Humanitarian Response, funded by the U.S. Department of State's Population, Migration, and Refugee Assistance (PMRA) appropriation, supported the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) in providing protection and assistance to Syrian refugees in Iraq. In 2017, Iraq hosted approximately 240,000 registered Syrian refugees, with about 90,000 residing in camps managed by UNHCR and partners.

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: INCOME GENERATION FOR IDP, REFUGEES AND SOCIALLY VULNERABLE HOUSEHOLDS IN HOST COMMUNITIES IN NORTHERN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: Income Generation for IDP, Refugees and Socially Vulnerable Households in Host Communities in Northern Iraq
LongDescription: In 2017, Germany, through KfW Development Bank, partnered with the International Organization for Migration (IOM) to implement a project aimed at improving income generation opportunities for internally displaced persons (IDPs), refugees, and socially vulnerable households in host communities across northern Iraq. The initiative focused on enhancing access to income and income-creating measures, facilitating the economic integration of displaced populations into local economies. By providing support for livelihoods and employment promotion, the project sought to foster economic stability and resilience among affected communities.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ShortDescription: INITIAL CONTRIBUTION TOWARDS UNITED NATIONS HIGH COMMISSIONER FOR REFUGEES (UNHCR)'S MIDDLE EAST AND NORTH AFRICA ANNUAL BUDGET ACTIVITIES ??IRAQIS
ProjectTitle: Initial Contribution Towards United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)'s Middle East and North Africa Annual Budget Activities Iraqis
LongDescription: The Initial Contribution Towards UNHCR's Middle East and North Africa (MENA) Annual Budget Activities for Iraqis, funded by the U.S. Department of State's Population, Migration, and Refugee Assistance appropriation, supported the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) in providing protection and assistance to Iraqi refugees and internally displaced persons (IDPs) in 2017. This funding aimed to address the needs of populations affected by conflict, including shelter, healthcare, and other essential services.

ShortDescription: VOLUNTARY CONTRIBUTION TO THE UNITED NATIONS HIGH COMMISSIONER FOR REFUGEES (UNHCR) 2018 GLOBAL APPEAL/SYRIA REGIONAL REFUGEE AND RESLIENCE PLAN (3RP)
ProjectTitle: Voluntary Contribution to the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) 2018 Global Appeal/Syria Regional Refugee and Reslience Plan (3RP)
LongDescription: The 2018 Voluntary Contribution to the UNHCR Global Appeal / Syria Regional Refugee and Resilience Plan (3RP), funded by the U.S. Department of State’s Population, Migration, and Refugee Assistance (PMRA), supported Syrian refugees in Iraq through the UNHCR-led 3RP framework. This initiative aimed to provide protection and assistance to Syrian refugees and host communities affected by the Syrian crisis.

ShortDescription: 2021 IOM CRP X[FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE- VOLUNTARY CONTRIBUTIONS]
ProjectTitle: 2021 IOM CRP X[Financial Assistance- Voluntary Contributions]
LongDescription: The Community Revitalization Program (CRP) Phase X, initiated in 2021 by the International Organization for Migration (IOM) with support from the U.S. Department of State's Bureau of Population, Refugees, and Migration (PRM), aimed to bolster stabilization efforts in Iraq. This phase focused on facilitating the return and reintegration of internally displaced persons (IDPs), enhancing community resilience, and promoting social cohesion through livelihood support, infrastructure rehabilitation, and peacebuilding activities. A significant implementation site for CRP Phase X was Habbaniyah in Anbar Governorate. In this area, IOM facilitated community-based reconciliation and reintegration efforts, supporting the return of displaced families and enhancing local capacities for conflict resolution.

ShortDescription: FUNDING FACILITY FOR IMMEDIATE STABILIZATION - FFIS (WINDOW THREE AND FOUR)
ProjectTitle: Funding Facility for Immediate Stabilization - FFIS (Window Three and Four)
PurposeName: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
LongDescription: Provision of immediate support to newly accessible areas in Iraq in order to create the conditions for the sustainable returns of internally displaces persons, through the FFIS. FFIS window 3= capacity support. FFIS window 4 = reconciliation. (FFIS = Funding Facility for Immediate Stabilization)

ShortDescription: CAPACITY BUILDING PROGRAMME FOR PRIMARY AND SECONDARY EDUCATION IN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: Capacity Building Programme for Primary and Secondary Education in Iraq
LongDescription: The overall objective is to improve the Iraqi education sector with focus on governance, structure and efficiency of financing for primary and secondary education.

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: IOM PHASE VI 'CONTRIBUTE TO THE ECONOMIC RECOVERY OF IRAQ THROUGH EMPLOYMENT CREATION AND REVITALIZATION OF LOCAL ECONOMY (VPT)
ProjectTitle: IOM Phase VI 'Contribute to the economic recovery of Iraq through employment creation and revitalization of local economy (VPT)
LongDescription: The project revitalises local economic systems in return regions of Iraq by means of training and business grants, but also by rebuilding local infrastructure. The project works with a family-based approach in order to provide them with holistic security and to bring them out of poverty by means of graduated, work-sharing support, training or employment measures. Through the targeted promotion of women, the project achieves a 40 percent share of women among the beneficiaries.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ProjectTitle: Humanitarian Demining
PurposeName: Removal of land mines and explosive remnants of war
LongDescription: In 2020, Tetra Tech, under contract with the U.S. Department of State’s Office of Weapons Removal and Abatement (PM/WRA), conducted humanitarian demining operations in Iraq. These efforts focused on clearing explosive remnants of war (ERW) and improvised explosive devices (IEDs) in areas previously occupied by ISIS, facilitating the safe return of displaced populations and the restoration of essential services.

ShortDescription: INITIAL CONTRIBUTION TOWARDS UNITED NATIONS HIGH COMMISSIONER FOR REFUGEES (UNHCR) S MIDDLE EAST AND NORTH AFRICA ANNUAL BUDGET ACTIVITIES - IRAQIS
ProjectTitle: Initial Contribution Towards United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) s Middle East and North Africa Annual Budget Activities - Iraqis
LongDescription: In 2013, the United States, through its Population, Migration, and Refugee Assistance (PMRA) appropriation, provided an initial contribution to the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) to support its Middle East and North Africa (MENA) Annual Budget Activities, focusing on the protection and assistance needs of Iraqi refugees and internally displaced persons (IDPs). This funding aimed to address the humanitarian needs arising from ongoing conflicts and displacement within Iraq.

ShortDescription: IRAQI KOREAN TREATMENT AND RESEARCH CENTER OF PEDIATRIC CARDIOLOGY
ProjectTitle: Iraqi Korean treatment and research center of pediatric cardiology
LongDescription: The "Iraqi-Korean Treatment and Research Center of Pediatric Cardiology" project, initiated in 2020 with a budget of approximately 20 million us dollars, is a collaborative effort between the Korea International Cooperation Agency (KOICA) and Iraq. This project aims to establish a specialized center for pediatric cardiology, focusing on building a dedicated hospital, providing essential medical equipment, developing an operational master plan, offering invitational training programs, and dispatching Korean medical experts to enhance local expertise and capacity.

ShortDescription: WORLD FOOD PROGRAMME IRAQ - EMERGENCY OPERATION (EMOP)
ProjectTitle: World Food Programme Iraq - Emergency Operation (EMOP)
LongDescription: In 2015, the World Food Programme (WFP), with funding from the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), implemented Emergency Operation (EMOP) 200677 to provide life-saving food assistance to populations affected by the crisis in Iraq. This operation targeted internally displaced persons (IDPs) and vulnerable households in conflict zones, particularly in areas with high concentrations of displaced individuals due to the ongoing conflict.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: EDUCATION AND LABOUR MARKET
ProjectTitle: Education and Labour Market
LongDescription: Support the development of a coherent Vocational and Technical Education and Training system that can respond to the needs of the labour market by providing well skilled and employable graduates

ShortDescription: SHELTER, PROTECTION, AND NFIS FOR RECENTLY DISPLACED POPULATIONSIN IRAQ - ASSISTANCE AND RECOVERY
ProjectTitle: Shelter, Protection, and NFIs for recently displaced populationsin Iraq - Assistance and Recovery
LongDescription: In 2016, the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), through its Office of U.S. Foreign Disaster Assistance (OFDA), funded emergency shelter, protection, and non-food item (NFI) assistance for recently displaced populations in Iraq. This initiative aimed to address the urgent needs of internally displaced persons (IDPs) affected by ongoing conflicts, providing essential support to enhance their safety, dignity, and well-being.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE SUPPORT THROUGH HEALTH AND WASH ACTIVITIES.
ProjectTitle: Humanitarian assistance support through health and WASH activities.
LongDescription: In 2019, the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), through its Office of U.S. Foreign Disaster Assistance (OFDA), provided substantial humanitarian assistance in Iraq, focusing on health and Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) activities. This support aimed to address the urgent needs of internally displaced persons (IDPs) and conflict-affected populations across the country. USAID/OFDA allocated nearly $51.9 million to WASH initiatives throughout Iraq. Key activities included providing safe drinking water to approximately 3,200 people through water trucking in Nimrud IDP camp and conducting hygiene awareness sessions in Hamdaniya and Tal Kayf for nearly 2,000 individuals. Additionally, USAID/OFDA partners constructed over 40 emergency latrines, including access ramps for persons with disabilities, in Hammam al-Alil and As Salamyiah IDP camps. They also supported the construction of two water storage tanks at As Salamyiah IDP camp.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: SHELTER, PROTECTION, AND NFIS FOR RECENTLY DISPLACED POPULATIONSIN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: Shelter, Protection, and NFIs for recently displaced populationsin Iraq
LongDescription: In 2016, the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), through its Office of U.S. Foreign Disaster Assistance (OFDA), funded humanitarian assistance projects in Iraq focusing on shelter, protection, and non-food items (NFIs) for recently displaced populations. These initiatives aimed to address the urgent needs of internally displaced persons (IDPs) affected by ongoing conflicts, providing essential support to enhance their safety, dignity, and well-being.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: PROVISION OF MUNICIPAL INFRASTRUCTURE PHASE II
ProjectTitle: Provision of Municipal Infrastructure Phase II
LongDescription: The project  Provision of Municipal Infrastructure  contributes to improving drinking water supply and strengthening sub-national actors in Iraq who are responsible for providing basic services. The aim of the project is to supply approx. 160,000 people in the target region with drinking water in their homes. To this end, investments will be made in a water treatment plant, pumping stations, water reservoirs, water networks, water meters and house connections. Furthermore, capacity-building measures will be implemented at the Muthanna Water Directorate to enable more efficient management of the drinking water supply. The introduction of consumption-based water tariffs in the target region after completion of the infrastructure is also part of the project. The project partners are the Iraqi Ministry of Construction, Housing, Municipalities and Public Works (MOCHMPW) and the Muthanna Water Directorate. In addition to the FC contribution, the Iraqi Government is making a substantial contribution. The project will be implemented in the south of Iraq in the target district of Al Khidr in Muthanna province.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: COUNTRY STRATEGIC PLAN
ProjectTitle: Country Strategic Plan
LongDescription: With the measures funded by the BMZ under Strategic Outcome 2 of the Country Strategic Plan, the resilience of vulnerable population groups is to be strengthened in rural regions as well as in urban and peri-urban areas in Iraq
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: UNOPS INFRASTRUCTURE FUNDING ANBAR - LIRA II
ProjectTitle: UNOPS Infrastructure Funding Anbar - LIRA II
PurposeName: Multisector aid for basic social services
LongDescription: The aim of this project is to strengthen the resilience of the population affected by internal displacement by renovating basic communal infrastructure, repairing living space and improving access to public services.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ShortDescription: IRAQ HUMANITARIAN AND STABILISATION PACKAGE
ProjectTitle: Iraq Humanitarian and Stabilisation Package
LongDescription: The last three years of armed conflict in Iraq have increased vulnerabilities for millions of Iraqis through widespread displacement, destruction of infrastructure and decreased stability. In 2017, the United Nations estimated that up to 11 million Iraqis would need humanitarian assistance in 2018, including 5.1 million children. As at October 2017, over 66,500 Iraqi civilians have died of war-related causes since 2014. The scale of protection needs in Iraq are so great the UN has described it as a 'protection crisis'. Since January 2014, nearly 3.2 million Iraqis have been internally displaced, including some who have been displaced multiple times. The overall objective of the package is to support international efforts to meet the humanitarian needs of the most vulnerable conflict-affected populations in Iraq, and assist communities become more resilient and stable.

ShortDescription: HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE - HUMANITARIAN AID IN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: Humanitarian Assistance - Humanitarian aid in Iraq
LongDescription: In 2016, Germany's Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ) provided humanitarian assistance in Iraq to address the escalating crisis caused by conflict and displacement. This support encompassed a range of measures aimed at alleviating the immediate needs of affected populations. Key interventions included the provision of shelter, non-food items, and winter assistance to displaced families, particularly in regions like Anbar and Ninewa governorates. Additionally, the BMZ supported initiatives to strengthen local capacities for crisis management and peacebuilding, bridging the gap between emergency relief and long-term development efforts.

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: IOM IRAQ - RECONSTRUCTION THROUGH EMPLOYMENT AND REVITALIZING THE LOCAL ECONOMY
ProjectTitle: IOM Iraq - Reconstruction through employment and revitalizing the local economy
LongDescription: Generation of income and employment opportunities for internally displaced persons, returnees and needy residents of receiving target communities, with additional special support for micro, small and medium-sized enterprises that offer COVID-19-relevant products or services, as well as cash-for-work-based support for hospitals and Health centers including relevant sanitation.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ShortDescription: HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE WINTER AID
ProjectTitle: Humanitarian Assistance Winter aid
LongDescription: In 2014, Germany's Federal Foreign Office allocated €20 million to provide winter aid for internally displaced persons (IDPs) in Iraq, particularly in the Kurdistan Region. This assistance aimed to alleviate the hardships faced by over 1.8 million displaced individuals, many of whom were residing in inadequate shelters such as unfinished buildings, schools, and tents. The support included the provision of winterized tents, heaters, mattresses, thermal blankets, and warm clothing to protect vulnerable populations from harsh winter conditions. Collaborating with the UN Refugee Agency (UNHCR) and German Agro Action, Germany's aid efforts focused on ensuring that displaced families had the necessary resources to survive the winter months

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: EDUCATION, CHILD PROTECTION AND RESILIENCE IN WINTER (UNITED NATIONS CHILDREN'S FUND)
ProjectTitle: Education, child protection and resilience in winter (United Nations Children's Fund)
LongDescription: Improving access to education and child protection services and the strengthening of winter resilience of the children on the run due to the battles for Mosul.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ShortDescription: FUNDING TO UNICEF FOR HPGE (DISASTER COORDINATION, POLICY AND READINESS): HUMANITARIAN COORDINATION AND INFO MANAGEMENT (USAID/OFDA)
ProjectTitle: Funding to UNICEF for HPGE (Disaster Coordination, Policy and Readiness): Humanitarian Coordination and Info Management (USAID/OFDA)
LongDescription: In 2017, the United States Agency for International Development's Office of U.S. Foreign Disaster Assistance (USAID/OFDA) provided funding to the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) for Humanitarian Policy, Guidance, and Evaluation (HPGE) activities in Iraq. This support aimed to enhance humanitarian coordination and information management, ensuring effective and timely responses to the needs of vulnerable populations affected by conflict and displacement.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ProjectTitle: 2020 Special Measures for Iraq Part 1

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: IOM IRAQ - ECONOMIC RECONSTRUCTION THROUGH EMPLOYMENT AND REVITALISATION OF THE LOCAL ECONOMY
ProjectTitle: IOM Iraq - Economic reconstruction through employment and revitalisation of the local economy
LongDescription: In 2019, the International Organization for Migration (IOM) implemented a project in Iraq aimed at contributing to the country's economic recovery through employment creation and the revitalization of local economies. This initiative focused on providing income and employment opportunities for internally displaced persons (IDPs), returnees, and vulnerable residents in host communities. Key activities included supporting micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises (MSMEs) that offer COVID-19-relevant products or services, as well as implementing cash-for-work programs in hospitals and health centers, including sanitation services. The project sought to enhance livelihoods, promote economic stability, and support the rebuilding of local economies affected by conflict and displacement.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
