ProjectTitle: Iraq Crisis - Support to the  Lost Generation Initiative in Iraq - UNICEF Multi Year
LongDescription: September 2016 - The humanitarian situation in Iraq continues to deteriorate as armed clashes between Daesh and government forces drive displacement. Since January 2014, over 3.3 million people have been displaced and an additional 887,000 previously displaced people have returned to their homes that have often been destroyed, making it one of the largest cases of internal displacement in the world. The impending battle to retake Mosul - Iraq's second biggest city - from Daesh could result in over a million more IDPs. Persecution of minority groups is an ongoing concern as well as the protection of women and children who are at an increased risk of (and in some cases targeted for) sexual violence such as rape, as well as child, early and forced marriage. Canada is helping reduce the vulnerability of hundreds of thousands of crisis-affected people, especially women and children, through a broad spectrum of humanitarian assistance activities across Iraq.     GAC's multi-year humanitarian support to UNICEF's Lost Generation(NLG) Initiative is contributing to improved access to education and protection in conflict-affected regions of Iraq. Project activities include: (1) improving access to quality learning in a progressively strengthened education system, including humanitarian situations, for children of basic and post-basic school age, especially girls, (2) improving access to child protection, sexual and gender-based violence (SGBV) prevention and response, youth empowerment, and resilience for Iraqi and refugee children affected by conflict, and (3) improving opportunities for gender-sensitive communities and social cohesion for adolescent and youth boys and girls affected by conflict.

ShortDescription: SUPPORT TO EMERGENCY IN IRAQ: CASH-BASED PROGRAMMING
ProjectTitle: Support to Emergency in Iraq: Cash-based programming
LongDescription: This programme will provide humanitarian aid to vulnerable populations in Iraq by (1) Responding to the needs of extremely vulnerable people including women and girls and (2) Supporting improvements in the UN humanitarian system. The programme will deliver life-saving assistance through: Flexible responses to sudden-onset emergencies through the Humanitarian Pooled Fund, and Assistance to protracted IDP caseloads through cash grants and improved access to public welfare. The programme will also fund research aimed at enabling a shift from humanitarian aid in-kind to cash grants. Support will also strengthen the humanitarian response such as the development of Government contingency coordination centres, improving safety and access reporting for NGOs and strengthening the UN response. The programme will contribute towards DFID Strategic Development Plan objectives 1 (strengthening global peace, security and governance) and 2 (strengthening resilience and response to crisis).
Name_of_Donor: United Kingdom, Department for International Development

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: IMPROVING THE LIVING CONDITIONS OF IRAQI INTERNALLY DISPLACED PERSONS AND THE LOCAL POPULATION IN THE PROVINCE OF DOHUK
ProjectTitle: Improving the living conditions of Iraqi internally displaced persons and the local population in the province of Dohuk
LongDescription: The project is located in the provinces of Dohuk and Erbil in the autonomous region of Kurdistan and contributes to stabilizing the situation, which is strongly affected by the consequences of the  onflict affected region. The focus here is on stabilising households frominternally displaced persons, refugees and people from host communities, as well as theresponsible state structures for education, vocational training and social affairs matters and their capacity to provide their services.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ShortDescription: HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE THROUGH WASH PROGRAMMING
ProjectTitle: Humanitarian assistance through WASH programming
LongDescription: In 2019, USAID funded WASH (Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene) initiatives in Iraq to improve health conditions for internally displaced persons (IDPs), returnees, and host communities. Activities included water trucking to Nimrud IDP camp, hygiene sessions in Hamdaniya and Tal Kayf, and construction of emergency latrines and water storage tanks in Hammam al-Alil and As Salamyiah IDP camps.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: IRAQ PROVINCIAL ELECTIONS ACTIVITY (IPEA)
ProjectTitle: Iraq Provincial Elections Activity (IPEA)
LongDescription: IFES Iraq Provincial Election Activity (IPEA) project provides technical and operational assistance to the IHEC as it prepares for the conduct of upcoming provincial elections scheduled for April 2020.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE PROTECTION AND ASSISTANCE IN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: Humanitarian Assistance Protection and assistance in Iraq
LongDescription: In 2015, Germany provided €12 million in humanitarian assistance to Iraq through the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR), focusing on the protection and aid of internally displaced persons (IDPs). This funding supported UNHCR's efforts to deliver core relief items such as shelter materials, non-food items, and emergency medical supplies to IDPs across various governorates, including Anbar and Baghdad. Additionally, Germany's support facilitated the establishment of temporary shelters and the provision of essential services to meet the urgent needs of displaced populations.

ShortDescription: GLOBAL MINE ACTION PROGRAMME 2 - MINE ACTION IN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: Global Mine Action Programme 2 - Mine Action in Iraq
PurposeName: Removal of land mines and explosive remnants of war
LongDescription: The UK has had an historic role in tackling the legacy of landmines and explosive remnants of war (ERW). We were one of the founding signatories to the Land Mine Ban Treaty in 1997. In the 20 years since then, the UK has supported some of the poorest countries around the world to clear landmines and ERW after conflict, building up considerable knowledge and experience in the mine action sector.  UK funding for mine action saves lives, releases land for productive use and helps pave the way for further development programming.  Through land mine and ERW clearance, mine risk education activities and capacity development of national and provincial authorities this programme will increase stability and security for people in countries affected by landmines and ERW.
Name_of_Donor: United Kingdom, Department for International Development

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: SUPPORT TO DECENTRALIZATION AND LOCAL DEVELOPMENT
ProjectTitle: Support to Decentralization and Local Development
PurposeName: Decentralisation and support to subnational government
LongDescription: Germany's 2017 project aimed to strengthen the capacities of key actors at the national and subnational levels in Iraq to effectively implement the decentralization process. Implemented by the Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH, the project focused on enhancing the administrative and financial autonomy of local governments, enabling them to better respond to citizens' needs and improve service delivery. Key activities included providing technical advisory services, conducting training programs for public administration staff, and supporting the development of local budget departments to manage their own finances. The project also facilitated the implementation of micro-projects in selected districts of 14 governorates, promoting local resource utilization and citizen engagement in planning and development processes. These efforts aimed to reduce the financial dependency of local governments on the national budget and promote sustainable local development.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ShortDescription: PROTECTION AND ASSISTANCE TO INTERNALLY DISPLACED PERSONS (IDPS), RETURNEES AND SYRIAN REFUGEES IN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: Protection and assistance to internally displaced persons (IDPs), returnees and Syrian refugees in Iraq
LongDescription: The "Protection and Assistance to Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs), Returnees, and Syrian Refugees in Iraq" project, initiated in 2019 with Japanese funding, aimed to support vulnerable populations affected by displacement and conflict. Implemented by UN-Habitat, the project focused on providing durable shelter solutions, including the construction of prefabricated shelter units equipped with basic infrastructure and public facilities. The initiative targeted several governorates, notably Ninewa, where a new shelter site was established to accommodate more than 400 vulnerable IDP families. The project also encompassed efforts in Baghdad and Dohuk, aiming to deliver shelters for over 6,500 vulnerable individuals across these regions. Additionally, the project provided legal assistance to up to 6,000 IDPs and 2,800 Syrian refugees, along with improved protection monitoring and enhanced access to civil documentation, psychosocial counseling, and strengthened prevention and response activities for sexual and gender-based violence.

ShortDescription: OPPORTUNITIES FORAS PROJECT - WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT
ProjectTitle: Opportunities Foras Project - Workforce Development
LongDescription: In 2013, USAID launched the Foras ("Opportunities") Project to enhance workforce development in Iraq, targeting youth, women, internally displaced persons (IDPs), and other vulnerable groups. Implemented by FHI 360 and ACDI/VOCA, the two-year initiative aimed to improve job seekers' skills through training and support entrepreneurs with grants for start-up ideas. Foras operated in five key economic hubs: Baghdad, Basra, Karbala, Najaf, and Erbil, utilizing job fairs and digital platforms to connect job seekers with employers.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE ACTIVITY - HEALTH, PROTECTION AND SHELTER & SETTLEMENT
ProjectTitle: Humanitarian Assistance Activity - Health, Protection and Shelter & Settlement
LongDescription: In 2020, USAID's Bureau for Humanitarian Assistance supported a multi-sectoral response in Iraq to address urgent needs of internally displaced persons (IDPs), focusing on health, protection, and shelter. Activities included mobile health services, psychosocial support, and shelter upgrades in IDP camps and return areas across governorates such as Ninewa, Salah al-Din, and Anbar
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: UNICEF AWARD FOR CHILD PROTECTION, WINTERIZATION AND GBV SERVICES
ProjectTitle: UNICEF award for Child Protection, Winterization and GBV services
LongDescription: In 2019, UNICEF, with support from USAID, implemented a humanitarian program in Iraq focusing on child protection, winterization, and gender-based violence (GBV) services. The initiative provided psychosocial support, case management, and winter clothing to vulnerable children and women, particularly in IDP camps and conflict-affected areas
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: PROVISION OF EMERGENCY COMMODITIES, SHELTER, AND WATER, SANITATION AND HYGIENE SERVICES FOR CONFLICT AFFECTED POPULATIONS IN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: Provision of emergency commodities, shelter, and water, sanitation and hygiene services for conflict affected populations in Iraq
LongDescription: USAID provided emergency assistance in Iraq to support conflict-affected populations with shelter, water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) services. The program focused on formal camps and screening sites in Ninewa and Salah al-Din governorates, including Haj Ali, Al Alam 3/4, Al Shirqat, and Al Karama/Al Sh'hamah.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: EMERGENCY HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE
ProjectTitle: Emergency Humanitarian Assistance
LongDescription: USAID's Bureau for Humanitarian Assistance funded a $12.9 million initiative to strengthen essential primary, referral, and preventive healthcare services in conflict-affected areas of Iraq. The program aimed to enhance access to healthcare for vulnerable populations, including internally displaced persons (IDPs), returnees, and host communities. Activities encompassed the provision of essential medicines, medical supplies, and services; integration of gender-based violence (GBV) and mental health support into health programming; and training for healthcare professionals on outbreak preparedness and response. The initiative targeted several governorates, including Ninewa, Salah al-Din, and Anbar, focusing on areas with significant healthcare needs.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: ENABLING DURABLE SOLUTIONS
ProjectTitle: Enabling Durable Solutions
PurposeName: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
LongDescription: USAID's "Shared Future" project, launched in June 2018, aimed to enable durable solutions for internally displaced persons (IDPs) returning to the Ninewa Plains, focusing on social cohesion, livelihoods, and community rehabilitation. The initiative supported families from diverse religious and ethnic backgrounds, including Christians, Yazidis, and Shabak, facilitating their reintegration into communities such as Qaraqosh (Hamdaniya), Bartella, and Bashiqa. Activities encompassed youth livelihoods programs, peacebuilding efforts among community and religious leaders, and the restoration of essential services and infrastructure.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE - SUPPORT THROUGH SHELTER, WASH, AND ERM
ProjectTitle: Humanitarian Assistance - Support through Shelter, WASH, and ERM
LongDescription: Support people affected by conflict through Shelter, WASH, and ERMS so they can live with dignity in areas of displacement or return.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: PROTECTION AND ASSISTANCE TO INTERNALLY DISPLACED PERSONS (IDPS), RETURNEES, AND SYRIAN REFUGEES IN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: Protection and assistance to internally displaced persons (IDPs), returnees, and Syrian refugees in Iraq
LongDescription: The "Protection and Assistance to Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs), Returnees, and Syrian Refugees in Iraq" project, launched in 2021 with Japanese funding, aimed to support vulnerable populations affected by displacement and conflict. Implemented by UN-Habitat, the project focused on providing durable shelter solutions, including the construction of prefabricated shelter units equipped with basic infrastructure and public facilities. The initiative targeted several governorates, notably Ninewa, where a new shelter site was established to accommodate more than 400 vulnerable IDP families. The project also encompassed efforts in Baghdad and Dohuk, aiming to deliver shelters for over 6,500 vulnerable individuals across these regions. Additionally, the project provided legal assistance to up to 6,000 IDPs and 2,800 Syrian refugees, along with improved protection monitoring and enhanced access to civil documentation, psychosocial counseling, and strengthened prevention and response activities for sexual and gender-based violence.

ShortDescription: ACUTE HUMANITARIAN NEED
ProjectTitle: Acute Humanitarian Need
LongDescription: In 2014, Daesh's expansion across Iraq set ablaze a major humanitarian crisis, compelling the UK to respond to acute needs, and also to join the counter-Daesh global coalition.  Daesh has now been defeated as a territory-holding force, and increasing numbers of people have returned home.  However, the situation is precarious, and complex humanitarian needs remain for many.    From 2019-2022, DFID Iraq will respond to the acute needs of the most vulnerable, address the complex needs of high-risk protracted caseloads, promote responsible transition to national-led efforts, and fund enabling activities crucial to achieving this.   The funding envelope for this programme reflects that DFID Iraq is planning for the best, but preparing for the worst ??a seemingly optimistic trajectory one month may belie a precarious situation the next.  DFID Iraq will monitor any deterioration, setting trigger points to indicate if or when we will approach ministers for any critical change in approach.
Name_of_Donor: United Kingdom, Department for International Development

ShortDescription: OPPORTUNITIES  FORAS  PROJECT - STRENGTHEN MICROENTERPRISE PRODUCTIVITY
ProjectTitle: Opportunities  Foras  Project - Strengthen Microenterprise Productivity
LongDescription: USAID's Foras Project in 2013 aimed to strengthen microenterprise productivity in Iraq by supporting entrepreneurs through training, information-sharing, and access to grants for promising start-up ideas. The initiative focused on enhancing economic opportunities for youth, women, internally displaced persons (IDPs), and other vulnerable populations across key economic hubs, including Baghdad, Basra, Karbala, Najaf, and Erbil.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: FOOD ASSISTANCE FOR THE POPULATION AFFECTED BY THE CONFLICT
ProjectTitle: Food assistance for the population affected by the conflict
LongDescription: In 2017, Germany provided €600,000 in humanitarian assistance to support internally displaced persons (IDPs) affected by the ongoing conflict in Iraq. This funding was allocated through Oxfam GB to deliver essential relief to vulnerable populations, including food aid, shelter, and other critical services. The assistance aimed to alleviate the hardships faced by IDPs and contribute to their protection and well-being during a period of significant displacement and instability.

ShortDescription: FY18 AWARD FOR WASH AND PROTECTION IN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: FY18 award for WASH and Protection in Iraq
LongDescription: USAID's FY18 award for WASH and Protection in Iraq aimed to improve access to safe water, sanitation, and hygiene services, alongside protection initiatives for vulnerable populations, including internally displaced persons (IDPs), returnees, and host communities. The program focused on rehabilitating water infrastructure, promoting hygiene practices, and providing protection services to mitigate risks faced by affected populations.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: MULTI-SECTOR HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE OF VULNERABLE PROTECTED DISPLACED POPULATIONS AND CON
ProjectTitle: Multi-sector humanitarian assistance of vulnerable protected displaced populations and con
LongDescription: USAID’s 2019 humanitarian program in Iraq provided multi-sectoral assistance—including protection, water, sanitation, hygiene (WASH), shelter, emergency relief, and coordination—to conflict-affected populations such as internally displaced persons (IDPs) and returnees. The initiative aimed to improve living conditions and support dignified recovery in displacement and return areas.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: EXPAND ACCESS TO THE MOST VULNERABLE REFUGEES AND HOST COMMUNITY&RSQUO,S SCHOOL AGED CHILDREN IN ERBIL GOVERNORATE, IRAQ
ProjectTitle: Expand access to the most Vulnerable refugees and host communitys school aged children in Erbil Governorate, Iraq
LongDescription: In line with Intergrated Educaiton Policy, which is designed by Iraq Kurd Regional Government, the project establishes an integrated model school that covers primary, middle, high shool with an newly adopted education policy. In addition, the project is aimed at renovating 41 schools in KRG jundicial provinces and etablishes a model library of the integrated school with the new education curriculum.

ShortDescription: WASH SERVICES
ProjectTitle: WASH services
LongDescription: Comprehensive approach to the provision of water, sanitation and hygiene assistance to vulnerable communities across Iraq
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: ASSISTANCE, PROTECTION, PREVENTION AND COOPERATION MEASURES IN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: Assistance, protection, prevention and cooperation measures in Iraq
LongDescription: In 2020, Germany committed €25.1 million to Iraq through its humanitarian assistance program, focusing on protection, prevention, and cooperation measures to support vulnerable populations affected by conflict and displacement. This funding was channeled through the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) and the Iraq Humanitarian Fund, aiming to address urgent humanitarian needs and promote long-term stability in the country

ShortDescription: IRAQ CRISIS - EMERGENCY FOOD ASSISTANCE - WORLD FOOD PROGRAMME 2015 / CRISE EN IRAQ - ASSISTANCE ALIMENTAIRE D'URGENCE - PROGRAMME ALIMENTAIRE MONDIAL
ProjectTitle: Iraq Crisis - Emergency Food Assistance - World Food Programme 2015
LongDescription: March 2015 - The humanitarian situation in Iraq continues to deteriorate. The violence between armed groups and government forces has displaced over 2.4 million people from their homes. An estimated 5.2 million people in Iraq have been affected by the conflict and are in need of humanitarian assistance. Basic services, including health care and water infrastructure, are disrupted, resulting in acute humanitarian needs.   With the support of DFATD and other donors, the United Nations World Food Programme (WFP) is providing emergency food assistance to up to 1.5 million vulnerable crisis-affected people across Iraq and addressing the critical nutritional needs of young children and pregnant and lactating women in crisis-affected areas of Iraq. Project activities include: (1) providing assistance such as food, cash and family food parcels, (2) providing nutritional support to treat and prevent acute and chronic malnutrition and micronutrient deficiencies, and (3) supporting school feeding programs.

ShortDescription: FIRST TRANCHE - SYRIA REGIONAL REFUGEE AND RESILIENCE PLAN (3RP) - IRAQ
ProjectTitle: First Tranche - Syria Regional Refugee and Resilience Plan (3RP) - Iraq
LongDescription: United States Population Migration and Refugee Assistance, Appropriation 1143.  Protection and assistance needs of refugees, migrants and conflict vicitms worldwide. [United Nations Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees]

ShortDescription: ERMS, SHELTER, WASH
ProjectTitle: ERMS, Shelter, WASH
LongDescription: USAID's 2018 humanitarian assistance in Iraq focused on providing emergency relief in the sectors of Economic Recovery and Market Systems (ERMS), Shelter, and Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) to support conflict-affected populations, including internally displaced persons (IDPs) and returnees. The program aimed to improve living conditions and support dignified recovery in displacement and return areas.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: PRIMARY HEALTH CARE SERVICES FOR CONFLICT AFFECTED POPULATIONS IN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: Primary health care services for conflict affected populations in Iraq
LongDescription: In 2016, USAID supported the provision of primary healthcare services for conflict-affected populations in Iraq, focusing on internally displaced persons (IDPs) and host communities. The initiative aimed to enhance access to essential health services, including maternal and child health, immunizations, and treatment for common illnesses. Efforts were concentrated in areas with significant displacement, such as Ninewa and Erbil governorates.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: IRAQ ECONOMIC RECOVERY THROUGH EMPLOYMENT AND THE REVIVAL OF THE LOCAL ECONOMY
ProjectTitle: Iraq Economic Recovery through Employment and the Revival of the Local Economy
LongDescription: Germany's 2018 initiative, "Contribute to the Economic Recovery of Iraq through Employment Creation and Revitalization of Local Economies," aimed to bolster Iraq's post-conflict recovery by fostering economic growth and job creation. Implemented by the International Organization for Migration (IOM) with funding from the German Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ) through KfW Development Bank, the project focused on supporting small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) and enhancing livelihoods in conflict-affected areas. Key activities included providing grants to SMEs, offering vocational training, and facilitating cash-for-work opportunities to improve infrastructure and community services. The project targeted vulnerable populations, including internally displaced persons (IDPs), returnees, and host communities, aiming to promote social cohesion and economic stability.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ShortDescription: UNDP FFS IRAQ 2018
ProjectTitle: UNDP FFS Iraq 2018
PurposeName: Multisector aid for basic social services
LongDescription: Sida will provide a 1-year support to the UNDP Fund Facility for Stabilisation (FFS) with 100 MSEK. The facility consists of two channels of support, the original Funding Facility for Immediate Stabilisation (FFIS) and the more recently established channel Funding Facility for Expanded Stabilisation (FFES). The FFS aim at immediate stabilisation and early recovery measures in the newley liberated areas of ISIL control, in order for sustainable return of internally displaced persons (IDP) back to these areas (focus four governorat, Anbar, Salah al-Din, Diyala, Nineweh including east and west Mosul).

ShortDescription: EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE TO POPULATION AFFECTED BY THE IRAQ CRISIS
ProjectTitle: Emergency Assistance to Population Affected by the Iraq Crisis
LongDescription: The "Emergency Assistance to Population Affected by the Iraq Crisis" project, initiated in 2015 with Japanese funding, aimed to provide urgent food assistance to communities affected by the ongoing conflict in Iraq. Implemented by the United Nations World Food Programme (WFP), the project focused on delivering food aid to internally displaced persons (IDPs) and other vulnerable populations across the country. This assistance was crucial in addressing the immediate nutritional needs of those displaced by violence and instability.

ShortDescription: IRAQ HEALTH AND PROTECTION SERVICES
ProjectTitle: Iraq Health and Protection Services
LongDescription: Provision of Health and Protection Services for Vulnerable IDPs, Returnees and Host Communities in Iraq
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: FUNDING FACILITY FOR EXPANDED STABILISATION
ProjectTitle: Funding Facility for Expanded Stabilisation
LongDescription: Germany's 2018 contribution to the UNDP's Funding Facility for Stabilization (FFS) focused on the Funding Facility for Expanded Stabilization (FFES), aimed at strengthening the Iraqi government's capacity for stabilization and reconstruction in areas liberated from ISIS. Germany's Ministry of Foreign Affairs provided an additional €22 million to the FFS in December 2018, bringing its total contribution to €80.2 million, part of a broader €209.9 million commitment to stabilization efforts in Iraq
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ShortDescription: HELP AND PROTECTION MEASURES IN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: Help and protection measures in Iraq
LongDescription: In 2020, Germany allocated €21.4 million to support internally displaced persons (IDPs), refugees, and returnees in Iraq, with a focus on protection and assistance measures. This funding was channeled through the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) and other humanitarian partners. The assistance aimed to address the challenges faced by vulnerable populations, including legal aid, child protection services, prevention and response to sexual and gender-based violence, and community-based protection. Additionally, cash-based interventions were implemented to help families meet their basic needs during the COVID-19 pandemic

ShortDescription: FUNDING FACILITY FOR IMMEDIATE STABILIZATION - FFIS (WINDOW THREE AND FOUR) 2019
ProjectTitle: Funding Facility for Immediate Stabilization - FFIS (Window Three and Four) 2019
PurposeName: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
LongDescription: Provision of immediate support to newly accessible areas in Iraq in order to create the conditions for the sustainable returns of internally displaces persons, through the FFIS. FFIS window 3= capacity support. FFIS window 4 = reconciliation (FFIS = Funding Facility for Immediate Stabilization).

ShortDescription: FUNDING FACILITY FOR STABILIZATION (FFS) IN IRAQ/FACILIT횋 DE FINANCEMENT POUR LA STABILISATION (FFS)
ProjectTitle: Funding Facility for Stabilization (FFS) in Iraq
LongDescription: The project supports the Funding Facility for Stabilization (FFS) in Iraq, the international community's primary mechanism for advancing stabilization and early recovery efforts in areas that have been liberated from Daesh, including devastated cities such as Mosul and Ramadi. The FFS assists the Government of Iraq in facilitating the safe return of internally displaced persons to liberated communities. This project also supports Iraq's recovery from conflict by funding FFS initiatives that have the potential for longer-term development impact, with a focus on livelihoods projects. Project activities include: (1) providing cash-for-work opportunities to women, such as light rehabilitation work at public facilities and schools, (2) providing long-term employment opportunities for youth and women entrepreneurs, through cash grants and capacity support to small and medium-sized enterprises, (3) revitalizing the agriculture sector to support farmers and their families in rural areas and contribute to their enhanced food security, and (4) supporting the young labour force of Iraq through rehabilitation of Student Resource Centre facilities on university campuses, critical skills programs, and engagement of private sector companies/businesses in job fairs and apprenticeships.

ShortDescription: RECONCILIATION AND COMMUNITY COHESION
ProjectTitle: Reconciliation and Community Cohesion
PurposeName: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
LongDescription: The UK's 2018 "Reconciliation and Community Cohesion" programme in Iraq aimed to foster social cohesion and counter violent extremism in areas affected by conflict. Implemented through the Iraq Security, Justice and Reconciliation Programme, it focused on gender-sensitive community-level reconciliation to rebuild trust within communities that had lived under ISIS. The programme supported local initiatives, including the establishment of Local Peace Committees (LPCs), and provided training to youth and women's groups to facilitate the return of internally displaced persons (IDPs) and assist in resolving community conflicts. Additionally, it strengthened national systems for coordinating and planning social cohesion and reconciliation efforts .

ShortDescription: ASSISTING STABILIZATION, HUMANITARIAN EFFORTS AND CIVILIAN RETURNS IN RETAKEN AREAS WITH EXPLOSIVE THREAT MITIGATION
ProjectTitle: Assisting Stabilization, Humanitarian Efforts and Civilian Returns in Retaken Areas with Explosive Threat Mitigation
PurposeName: Removal of land mines and explosive remnants of war
LongDescription: demining

ShortDescription: HUMANITARIAN DEMINING - DEPOSIT INTO THE VOLUNTARY TRUST FUND
ProjectTitle: Humanitarian Demining - Deposit into the Voluntary Trust Fund
PurposeName: Removal of land mines and explosive remnants of war
LongDescription: In 2017, Germany supported humanitarian demining efforts in Iraq, focusing on improving access to healthcare by establishing three health units, including one dedicated to psychosocial health services. This initiative was part of broader efforts to enhance the well-being of populations affected by conflict.

ShortDescription: SPECIAL MEASURE ON THE CONTRIBUTION TO THE EUROPEAN UNION REGIONAL TRUST FUND IN RESPONSE TO THE SYRIAN CRISIS,  THE MADAD FUND
ProjectTitle: special measure on the contribution to the European Union Regional Trust Fund in response to the Syrian crisis,  the Madad Fund
PurposeName: Upper Secondary Education (modified and includes data from 11322)
LongDescription: The overall objective of this contribution is to provide a coherent and reinforced aid response to the Syrian crisis in Iraq.

ShortDescription: FAO IRAQ 2022: ENHANCE CLIMATE RESILIENCE IN SOUTHERN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: FAO Iraq 2022: Enhance climate resilience in Southern Iraq
LongDescription: During the operationalization of Sweden  s new cooperation strategy for Iraq, discussions have been held with relevant partners who could implement a larger project to contribute to the new target area Environment, climate and sustainable development, and in particular to improved adaptability and resilience to climate change. After analysing the context, support to contribute to climate-smart agriculture in southern Iraq was identified as a relevant and suitable area of intervention. FAO was judged to have the right competence and capacity and was asked to develop a full-scale project proposal. In brief, the project aims to address the challenges described above by improving water use in agriculture and to contribute to improved land and water productivity and in particular by improving the efficiency of irrigation systems. The project will work with Iraqi actors who provide advice to farmers so that these in turn can support farmers to adopt improved climate-adapted cultivation methods to a greater extent. Furthermore, the project aims to strengthen institutions responsible for water management and distribution of water resources. The expected result is an improved living situation for women and men and an improved resilience of vulnerable rural communities in Missan, Al-Muthanna, Najaf and Thi-Qar in southern Iraq. In two of these regions, Najaf and Al-Muthanna, the Sida-financed project will co-finance efforts together with the Green Climate Fund (GCF) project  Strengthening climate Resilience of Vulnerable Agriculture Livelihoods in Iraq , provided that Iraq  s GCF application is approved. The project areas have been identified based on factors that included vulnerability to the impact of climate change on food security. To ensure that the project contributes to the broader aspects of sustainability, FAO will pilot its Climate Smart Agriculture plus approach (CSA+) to improve in particular: (i) gender equality and inclusiveness, (ii) anti-corruption/improved governance, (iii) balanced ecosystems and biodiversity and (iv) reduced land, water and air pollution.

ShortDescription: FFIS INFRASTRUCTURE REHABILITATION
ProjectTitle: FFIS Infrastructure Rehabilitation
PurposeName: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
LongDescription: Germany's 2016 contribution to the UNDP's Funding Facility for Immediate Stabilization (FFIS) focused on providing essential electricity materials and municipal equipment to newly liberated areas in Iraq. This support aimed to restore basic services and infrastructure, facilitating the safe return of internally displaced persons (IDPs) and promoting stabilization in conflict-affected regions.

ShortDescription: COUNTER-IED MEASURES IN IRAQ
ProjectTitle: counter-IED measures in Iraq
PurposeName: Removal of land mines and explosive remnants of war
LongDescription: In 2016, Germany contributed to counter-improvised explosive device (C-IED) efforts in Iraq by providing training and infrastructure support to enhance local capabilities in detecting and neutralizing IEDs. The German military's involvement included establishing a dedicated C-IED training facility at the Binaslawa Training Center near Erbil, which was officially handed over to the Kurdish Zeravani forces. This facility, known as "The German Village," was designed to simulate urban environments for realistic training scenarios, focusing on IED identification and mitigation techniques. German instructors played a pivotal role in delivering specialized training to Kurdish security forces, equipping them with the necessary skills to address the IED threat effectively. This initiative was part of Germany's broader commitment to support Iraq's stabilization and security efforts during a critical period.

ShortDescription: BREAKING THE CYCLE OF SECTARIAN VIOLENCE
ProjectTitle: Breaking the Cycle of Sectarian Violence
LongDescription: The overall objective is to break the cycle of sectarian violence in Iraq.

AgencyName: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
ShortDescription: STABILIZATION AND EMPLOYMENT UNDP
ProjectTitle: Stabilization and Employment UNDP
LongDescription: Similar to Phase I, the objective of this SI-Project is to improve income security and socio-economic inclusion of IDPs, returnees and the host population in the target areas through the creation of short-, medium- and long-term income and employment opportunities.
Name_of_Donor: Germany, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development

ProjectTitle: NFIs, WASH, Shelter, and Humanitarian Coordination/Information Management for conflict affected populations in Iraq
LongDescription: Distribution of non-food items to conflict affected populations. Shelter support and water, sanitation and hygiene services for displaced populations in Iraq. The program focused on areas with significant displacement, including Ninewa, Salah al-Din, and Anbar governorates, aiming to improve access to essential services and support dignified living conditions.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: USAID MISCELLANEOUS GOODS, SERVICES, AND OPERATIONS MAINTANENCE
ProjectTitle: USAID Miscellaneous Goods, Services, and Operations Maintanence
LongDescription: USAID's 2018 "Miscellaneous Goods, Services, and Operations Maintenance" funding in Iraq covered administrative and operational expenses essential for mission support. This included salaries and benefits for U.S. direct-hire staff, facility maintenance, IT systems, and logistics, all categorized under Operating Expenses as administrative costs
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: HUMANITARIAN SUPPORT FOR IDPS IN IRAQ - ASSISTANCE AND RECOVERY
ProjectTitle: Humanitarian support for IDPs in Iraq - Assistance and Recovery
LongDescription: USAID's 2016 humanitarian assistance in Iraq provided cash and voucher support for essential needs, along with water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) services to internally displaced persons (IDPs) and vulnerable communities. The program aimed to address immediate life-saving needs and improve living conditions in areas affected by conflict.
Name_of_Donor: United States, Agency for International Development

ShortDescription: FUNDING FACILITY FOR IMMEDIATE STABILISATION - FFIS (WINDOW THREE AND FOUR) 2022
ProjectTitle: Funding Facility for Immediate Stabilisation - FFIS (Window three and four) 2022
PurposeName: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
LongDescription: Germany's 2023 support for the UNDP's Funding Facility for Immediate Stabilization (FFIS) focused on preserving and enhancing stabilization gains in Iraq, particularly through Windows Three and Four. Window Three aimed to strengthen the capacity of local and national government institutions, enabling them to effectively manage and sustain stabilization efforts. This included providing technical assistance, training, and resources to enhance governance and service delivery. Window Four concentrated on promoting social cohesion by fostering dialogue and reconciliation among diverse communities, addressing the root causes of conflict, and building trust in public institutions. These interventions were designed to create an enabling environment for the safe and sustainable return of internally displaced persons (IDPs) and to support long-term peace and stability in the country.

ShortDescription: FY2016 SECOND TRANCHE CONTRIBUTION TO INTERNATIONAL COMMITTEE OF THE RED CROSS (ICRC) 2016 EMERGENCY APPEAL-IRAQ
ProjectTitle: FY2016 Second Tranche Contribution to International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) 2016 Emergency Appeal-Iraq
LongDescription: United States Population Migration and Refugee Assistance, Appropriation 1143.  Protection and assistance needs of refugees, migrants and conflict vicitms worldwide. [International Committee of the Red Cross]

ShortDescription: INTERNATIONAL NARCOTICS & LAW ENFORCEMENT: UNSPECIFIED (SUPPLEMENTAL)
ProjectTitle: International Narcotics & Law Enforcement: Unspecified (Supplemental)
LongDescription: In 2013, the U.S. Department of State's Bureau of International Narcotics and Law Enforcement Affairs (INL) allocated supplemental funding under the International Narcotics Control and Law Enforcement (INCLE) account to support Iraq's law enforcement and judicial sectors. This funding aimed to enhance the capabilities of Iraqi institutions in combating narcotics trafficking, organized crime, and corruption. Key initiatives included training programs for police and judicial personnel, development of forensic laboratories, and support for corrections system reforms. These efforts were part of a broader strategy to promote the rule of law and strengthen criminal justice institutions in Iraq.

ShortDescription: DELIVERY OF HUMANITARIAN AND PROTECTION ASSISTANCE
ProjectTitle: Delivery of humanitarian and protection assistance
LongDescription: To respond to urgent humanitarian needs in Iraq and build the capacity of the Iraqi and international system to respond to the humanitarian crisis, and support the development of recovery and stabilisation activities
